title: Splitformer: An improved early-exit architecture for automatic speech recognition on edge devices
author: Maxence Lasbordes (Universite Paris-Dauphine, Université PSL, Télécom SudParis, Institut Polytechnique de Paris), Daniele Falavigna (Center for Augmented Intelligence Fondazione Bruno Kessler), Alessio Brutti (Center for Augmented Intelligence Fondazione Bruno Kessler), ...
relevance_why: The Splitformer architecture introduces an efficient early-exit strategy which can enhance automatic speech recognition (ASR) applications in resource-constrained environments, relevant for audio-based tasks.
background: The task involves developing a speech recognition model that can process input at varying complexity levels and adjust its computational load accordingly for real-time applications.
contribution: This paper introduces the Splitformer architecture to solve the efficiency issues in automatic speech recognition, achieving significant reductions in word error rates on standard benchmarks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous early-exit architectures optimize performance but often lack integration with variable frame rates, making them less efficient on edge devices.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by incorporating parallel layers that process downsampled inputs, allowing for dynamic computational efficiency while maintaining ASR performance.

key_innovation: The introduction of parallel layers in the architecture that allows for processing different frame rates dynamically leads to improved efficiency and performance.
real_world_impact: The proposed architecture has significant implications for deploying ASR systems on edge devices, enhancing their usability in real-time applications like virtual assistants and transcription tools with limited computational resources.

new_terms.early-exit architecture: **Early-exit architecture** refers to neural network designs that allow for predictions to be made at intermediate layers, thus saving computation time when the input is easier to classify.
new_terms.downsampling: **Downsampling** refers to the process of reducing the sampling rate or resolution of data, often used to decrease computational load in processing streams.
